title: PFM Analysis of Moiré Patterns in a WSe2-WS2-WSe2 Heterostructure
description: Piezoresponse Force Microscopy (PFM) study of a WSe2-WS2-WSe2 heterostructure (Device 10). The measurements aim to characterize the moiré superlattices formed in different regions of the device, including bilayer (tWSe2-WS2, WS2-bWSe2) and trilayer (tWSe2-WS2-bWSe2) areas. Fast Fourier Transform (FFT) analysis of the high-resolution PFM images is used to determine the moiré wavelengths, revealing both a primary bilayer moiré of ~8.3nm (corresponding to ~0 degree twist angle) and larger, distorted moiré periods (19-40nm) in the trilayer regions.
